messages: 5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (08:13): back in NL

5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (08:15): the good thing about 24 hour aeroplane trips (twice) is that you can catch up with all the good movies, finish your book, see some tv series, get sleep, read some newspaper material and get free food and wine all the time

5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (08:22): to continue my monologue, I saw Babel, Blood Diamond, The Pursuit of Happyness, Freedom Writers, The Good Shepherd, The Holiday (not very good), Code Name: The Cleaner (not very good) and some other film of which I can't remember the title
5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (08:23): about a teacher having an affair with a student and some other teacher abusing that situation
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (08:24): that's a whole lotta movies
5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (08:24): 24 hours going there and 24 hours going back :)
5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (08:25): also some episodes of The Simpsons and The Office (American edition)
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (08:26): you're back in time to watch the WG play Musical Chairs
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (08:26): maybe once we get up to 10, people will feel the minimum level of disagreement is met
5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (08:40): how does throwing more editors at the problem solve anything?
5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (08:41): isn't the editor solely the person who does all the hard work trying to please the WG?
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (08:42): apparently they can do that better if they are fighting each other

f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (08:42): 5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3: it depends on the group and the tracking issue system. I think one fundamental components of accountability of editing work is the issue tracking.
5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (08:43): there's a mailing list
5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (08:44): all debated WHATWG issues have a paper trail
5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (08:44): all the non-debated ones probably don't have consensus
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (08:44): do the non-debated ones go into the document?
5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (08:46): everything is in the document
5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (08:47): which makes it easier to see how things might interconnect, what ideas currently are, etc.
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (08:47): for the editor :)
5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (08:47): for progress too
5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (08:47): for me, as a reviewer, too
5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (08:48): what's wrong with it?
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (08:48): but how do you know as a reviewer if something has been already discussed.
5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (08:48): parts of the spec are marked as stable or unstable
5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (08:49): people made a little script that annotates the spec like that, although it's not entirely done yet
5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (08:49): though currently it's pretty clear through things like red blobs
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (08:49): interesting
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (08:49): using class names?
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (08:50): are there links back from the document to the mailing-list where the issue has been debated?
5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (08:50): I think the ids of the  section
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (08:50): or collecting the different thread
5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (08:50): you can use google for that
5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (08:50): or some other search engine of your choice, of course...
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (08:52): poor usability but it could work with efforts
5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (08:52): this approach might not accessible enough for everyone, but people will have to step forward to improve the situation in that case
5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (08:53): you can't leave it all up to the people who think it already works good enough, I think

f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (08:56): my main worry is that the web communities surrounding html feel that they own the specification. And lack of tracking (power of hyperlink) dilutes trust often.
5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (08:58): they just started feeling that or so?
5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (08:58): afaik HTML development was sort of on hold
5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (08:58): as far as the W3C was concerned anyway
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (08:59): it was not on hold. a part of the community decided to take one path, another community decided to take another path.
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (09:00): It is normal, it is part of market forces and pressures, on many sides with different type of interests.
5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (09:00): i'm not sure what you're trying to say
6ce98a4a7b6e097946960dcb1f2d404b (09:02): an effect of "standards via consensus" under capitalism
5fc737bb295227f3fddfc56d069349b3 (09:04): (WHATWG doesn't do the typical "consensus" deal though)
